meanings.definition: The act of serving as a master of ceremonies at a public event.
meanings.sent1: At the talent show, the compering was done with great enthusiasm and charm.
meanings.sent2: She excelled in compering the wedding reception, keeping the guests entertained.
meanings.sent3: The compering at the school assembly turned into a comedy show when the principal forgot his lines.
meanings.sent4: Her compering was like a guiding light, smoothly leading the event from one segment to the next.
meanings.sent5: The compering was so engaging that even the shyest attendees felt included and welcomed.

meanings.definition: The person who serves as a master of ceremonies at a public event.
meanings.sent1: The compering at the charity gala was handled by a seasoned professional.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the best compering in town for his charismatic presence on stage.
meanings.sent3: The compering for the fashion show was so stylish that even the models felt upstaged.
meanings.sent4: As the compering, she was the heartbeat of the event, keeping the energy high throughout.
meanings.sent5: The compering's smile was as bright as the spotlight, drawing everyone's attention.
